title: Washington and Photo on Education - process

content.question: Which of the following best conveys a reason for concern about “an educated Negro” as mentioned in Source 1?

choices.label: Access to education and professional training allowed many African Americans to rise out of poverty and become societal leaders challenging historic racial roles.
The development of Black Greek-letter organizations threatened the power of long-established white sororities and fraternities as social and cultural clubs.
The concern about declining contributions to white colleges and universities as HBCUs produced a growing number of successful businessmen.
Global exposure led to increasing international recognition of the religious and musical tradition of African American culture as a viable art forms.

content.answer: Access to education and professional training allowed many African Americans to rise out of poverty and become societal leaders challenging historic racial roles.

topic.text: 3.10: HBCUs, Black Greek Letter Organizations, and Black Education

skill.text: 1.B: Identify and explain the context of a specific event, development, or process.
